page.title: 15Grove School, Nailsea
page.content: The School has a good tradition of teaching its pupils to produce good work in their books. But a recent addition to the work of the children is learning how to use {computers.}We bought our first computer in 1983 and now, in 1985, we have 5 computers, each with its own disc drive. The computers are used in three main ways in the School;- -as machines on which the children can practice such drills as multiplication tables, spellings,etc. -as stimuli for creative writing with open-ended adventure stories being set by the computer for the pupils to finish -as machines on which the older children can learn how to program computers in a simple way. The Teachers complain that they can only just keep up with the children!
